    public class AccountActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
implements android.hardware.SensorEventListener
    Activity that launch the timer.

      • TIME_PARENT

        public static int TIME_PARENT
        The time between each data collection. By default, the value is 5 (in hours).

      • TIME_CHILD

        public static int TIME_CHILD
        The duration of a data collection. By default, the value is 10 (in seconds).

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Create the fields required like sensors and timer params. Buttons are setting up and linked to their function. Restore the user object stored in the database by using the login.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - If the activity is being re-initialized after previously being shut down then this Bundle contains the data it most recently supplied in onSaveInstanceState(Bundle).

      • setUser

        Change the user value with the one passed in parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - The new User object(User).

        Returns:
        The current login(String).

      • notify

        public void notify(java.lang.String time)
        Create and launch the notification. Pass the ActivityCheck object that contains all the sensors informations and th expected activity.
        Parameters:
        time - The time at the data collection, format HH:MM(String).
        See Also:
        getDataSensors(int)

      • getDataSensors

        private void getDataSensors(int compteurRegister)
        Collect data of sensors every 3 seconds and store in the database. When the timer is over, the location is getting too and we call the notify method.
        Parameters:
        compteurRegister - The timer of the collect(int).
        See Also:
        notify(String)

      • createActivityCheck

        private ActivityCheck createActivityCheck()
        Create ActivityCheck object that contains sensors and location informations and the expected activity. The real activity will be set in the NoticationActivity.
        Returns:
        Activity created(Activitycheck).
        See Also:
        findActivity(HashMap, Location, long)

      • findActivity

        private java.lang.String findActivity(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,SensorData> sensorInfos,
                                      Location location,
                                      long timestamp)
        Find the acitivty that the user is supposed to do by using habits stored in the database, the sensors and location data collected, the collection of activities by hour.
        Returns:
        Expected activity that we try to find(String).
        See Also:
        createActivityCheck()

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        Reset the user with the one stored in the database to be sure to have the current one (with last changes)
        Overrides:
        onResume in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

      • isAppOnForeground

        private boolean isAppOnForeground(android.content.Context context)
        Check if the apps is in foreground or not by checking each activity.
        Returns:
        True if the apps is in foreground, else False(booelan).
        See Also:
        getDataSensors(int)

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent event)
        This method is launched every time the values of a sensor change. Change the values of paramSensors with the new values.
        Specified by:
        onSensorChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:
        event - the SensorEvent object that contains the type of sensor activated and the new values.

      • onAccuracyChanged

        public void onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Sensor sensor,
                              int accuracy)
        Called when the accuracy of the registered sensor has changed. Unlike onSensorChanged(), this is only called when this accuracy value changes. Method never changed but it was needed to override it because of the SensorEventListener interface.
        Specified by:
        onAccuracyChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor.
        accuracy - The new accuracy of this sensor.

      • startRunnable

        public void startRunnable(android.view.View view)
        Start the timer and the data check, change the text to show the timer and hide the play button.
        Parameters:
        view - Play button that calls this method(View).

      • intialisationOfActivityStats

        private void intialisationOfActivityStats()
        Initialize the collection of activites use for searching the activity the user could do.
        See Also:
        weekActivitiesStat, weekEndActivitiesStat, getDataSensors(int)
